heading: raw data
subheading: web surfers spend 20 percent of their time online at the top 10 sites (media metrix) … eighty-six percent of online users with tvs and net-connected computers in the same room watch the tube and surf the web simultaneously (npd online research) … voice-over-ip telephony will reach 135 billion minutes of use by 2004, up […]
author: wired staff
text: web surfers spend 20 percent of their time online at the top 10 sites (media metrix) ... eighty-six percent of online users with tvs and net-connected computers in the same room watch the tube and surf the web simultaneously (npd online research) ... voice-over-ip telephony will reach 135 billion minutes of use by 2004, up from 2.7 billion today (international data corporation) ... today's 5.1 million online investors hold 11.2 million accounts and use 140 brokerages (gomez advisors/harris interactive) ... the number of computer viruses has doubled yearly since 1996 (icsa.net) ... in the next five years, the number of us households that bank online will triple to 24.2 million (dataquest) ... sixty percent of online users live outside the us; in three years this group will generate 64 percent of ecommerce spending (international data corporation) ... by 2002, ecommerce will save companies in industrialized nations $1.25 trillion annually in overhead such as distribution and order handling (giga information group) ... twenty-nine percent of female internet users plan to shop online during this holiday season, six times as many as in the same period last year (harris interactive) ... the web shopping boom will increase demand for warehouse space by 60 million square feet to 100 million over the next three years (prologis/forrester research)must readswipe thisnet free for allskirting the lawsuite surrenderpatrick doesn't work here anymoresurfing the interstellar internetpeoplejargon watchchristmas.eduthe biggest big ironthis nose knowssaving mirsailing through spaceraw data
